title: Fonts that go with Zapfino...
content:
Hi guys:

I will be designing a business card and some related stationary with Zapfino for client. The brand is 'Round the Bend Farm. I was thinking Engravers Gothic but I need more choices and I know you guys can help out.

Thanks all,

Mike Diaz

ps... NO OPTIMA!!! I'll fall asleep if I have to use it! :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: What does the Farm do? Who does it do it for?

What's so awful about Optima? Engravers isn't exactly real exciting....

(OK, it's really horrid!)

C'mon, there are lots of interesting faces (sans or serif) that go with Zapfino: apart from things like Eras, Flora, Baker Signet, Albertus, Friz Quadrata, and American Uncial, what about Lucida Sans or Myriad?

Yes, use no Optima.

I think with Zapfino you'd have to use something  
really "flat", wouldn't you? Like DIN or something.

hhp

Stephan\>

On our lovely pacific coast we use the term farm to mean a place where crops are grown and such.  
In the hot n' muggy east they use the word farm to mean a place where horses are trained and cared for.

So east coast = farm  
West coast = ranch

So I'm doing work a for equine ranch. My client has very romantic tastes. So that's why I chose Zapfino. And to be more precise- Zapfino Forte.  
Some of the suggestions are pretty good but more would be nice....

Mikey

PS... I'm also doing work for another 'farm'- Saddle Ridge Farm.

\> My client has very romantic tastes.

Oh. Scratch DIN then.

Wait, I know!  
 [http://typophile.com/node/28357](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317234100/http:/typophile.com/node/28357 "http://typophile.com/node/28357") \_  
And since it's brand-spanking-new, you'd have a sort of exclusivity.

hhp

I'm no expert on pairing typefaces, but I second Hrant's recommendation of Beorcana. Not only would it go nicely with Zapfino, but in my mind it seems very appropriate for your design for this ranch/farm.
Excellent idea, Hrant. Mikey, contact Carl and he may be willing to get you a prerelease license.

Horsing around with fonts again :-)

ChrisL
Chris is well on his way to receiving the coveted title of All-time Cheesy Pun Champion.
As my Scots ancestors would say "Neigh, Chris, say it isn't so!" ;-)

No pun has ever crossed my lips--I just have out-of-body-experiences frequently;-)

and that would be Feta cheese Stewf!

ChrisL

PS: Whoa, it's so Linda!

Ah yes, unbridled humour.... ;-)

Put a halter to this right now or you'll stirrup everyone else!

Thanks guys. I like that new font by carl- lovely lovely!

Mikey
